questions.text: Which symbol is used to declare variables in PHP?
questions.explanation: PHP variables are prefixed with $.

questions.text: Which function is used to output text in PHP?
questions.explanation: echo outputs text in PHP.

questions.text: Which superglobal is used to access form data sent via GET?
questions.explanation: $_GET contains form data sent via the HTTP GET method.

questions.text: Which operator is used for string concatenation in PHP?
questions.explanation: The dot (.) is used for string concatenation in PHP.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to define a function in PHP?
questions.explanation: PHP functions are defined with the 'function' keyword.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a valid PHP data type?
questions.explanation: PHP does not have a separate Character type.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to include files in PHP?
questions.explanation: PHP supports both include and require.

questions.text: Which PHP function returns the length of a string?
questions.explanation: strlen() returns the length of a string.

questions.text: Which function is used to connect to a MySQL database in modern PHP?
questions.explanation: mysqli_connect() is the improved way to connect to MySQL.

questions.text: Which operator is used to check equality in PHP?
questions.explanation: == checks value equality, === checks value and type.

questions.text: What will echo 5 . '5'; output?
questions.explanation: The dot operator concatenates â†’ 5 . '5' = '55'.

questions.text: Which superglobal contains session variables?
questions.explanation: $_SESSION stores session variables.

questions.text: Which PHP keyword is used to define a class?
questions.explanation: Classes in PHP are defined with the 'class' keyword.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to inherit a class in PHP?
questions.explanation: PHP uses 'extends' to inherit classes.

questions.text: Which keyword is used to implement an interface in PHP?
questions.explanation: PHP uses 'implements' for interfaces.

questions.text: Which function is used to check if a variable is set?
questions.explanation: isset() checks if a variable is set and not NULL.

questions.text: Which function is used to check if a variable is empty?
questions.explanation: empty() checks if a variable is empty or zero.

questions.text: Which function is used to destroy a session in PHP?
questions.explanation: session_destroy() is used to destroy a session.

questions.text: Which PHP function is used to output information about a variable?
questions.explanation: print_r() displays human-readable information about a variable.

questions.text: Which tag is used to start PHP code?
questions.explanation: PHP code starts with <?php.
